definition: (China's achievements of) producing an atomic bomb (1964) and hydrogen bomb (1967) and launching a satellite into space (1970)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Also a case in point is that China independently developed its atomic and hydrogen bombs and man- made satellites.
sentences.chinese: 中国独立自主地开发“两弹一星”也证明了这一点。

definition: Qian Xuesen (1911-2009), Chinese scientist and aeronautical engineer
Li Siguang (1889-1971), Mongol-born, Japanese trained geologist, prominent in early PRC oil exploration
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
Tsung-Dao Lee (1926-), Chinese American physicist, Columbia University, 1957 Nobel laureate
Zhao Zhongyao (1902-1998), Chinese pioneer nuclear physicist
Yang Liwei (1965-), astronaut, first Chinese citizen in space
